## 2. Nested Loops ### Worked Example > Print all pairs of numbers $(x, y)$ where $x \leq 10$ and $y \leq 20$. ``` python for i in range(11): # Why did we use 11 insteead of 10? for j in range(21): # Could we use x instead of j in this line? print((i, j)) # Why did we use the extra parentheses? ``` ### Faded Parsons Problem > Print all triples of numbers $(x, y, z)$ where $x \leq 10$, $y \leq 20$, and $z \leq 30$. for z in range(!BLANK): for !BLANK in range(21): for baz in range(11): print(!BLANK) ### Full Problem > Print all triples of numbers $(x, y, z)$ where $x \lt y \lt z \lt 20$. Order doesn't matter.
